clinical_study.brief_title: Ketamine for Reduction of Alcoholic Relapse
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Relapse in Severe Alcohol Use Disorder With the NMDA Receptor Antagonist Ketamine

brief_summary.textblock: 96 recently detoxified alcoholics will be randomized to receive either 3 sessions ketamine (0.8 mg/kg IV over 45 minutes) or placebo plus manualised psychological therapy, or 3 sessions of ketamine or placebo plus simple psychoeducation. Patients will be assessed at 3 and 6 months on a range of psychological and biological variables. Primary endpoints will be % days abstinent at 3 and 6 months and relapse rates at 6 months. Secondary endpoints include depressive symptoms, craving, quality of life.
